title: I want to add Raspberry Pi or Arduino to control a real 48v car motor. Can I connect them directly to the 48v battery and a resistor? - Quora

response.answer_text: No! it will fused/burned your Arduino or Raspberry Pi. Motor controller or motor driver used for controlling motor RPM, Torque and angle etcc… Find appropriate motor driver for your motor and controller via Arduino/ Raspberry Pi. In Automation, there is Pulse - direction type motor drivers are widely available. You can easily simulate this type of configuration in Raspberry Pi/ Arduino.

You will blow up an arduino or Pi if you connect to 48V. Don’t do that. You should be using a motor driver to drive the motor and arduino or Pi can drive the driver using 5V signal. When you say car motor what does that motor drive?
